item.title: About
item.description: I’m a computational social scientist, currently serving as an assistant professor of sociology at Indiana University Bloomington. Previously, I was a post-doctoral researcher at Northwestern University in the Science of Networks in Communities (SONIC) research group. I received my Ph.D. in Sociology from the University of California, Berkeley in August 2016. I also have degrees in Computer Engineering from Carnegie Mellon University and Secondary Education from George Washington University. I study organizations, communication, and quantitative methodologies.

item.title: Research
item.description: Methodology Link to heading My methodological work aims to do two things: (1) resolve methodological problems encountered in my substantive work and (2) (more interestingly) understand the relation between sociological theorizing and quantitative research. In particular, I’m investigating how semantic theories can be substantiated with statistical modeling and how quantitative statistical research can be applied to abductive theorizing. Relevant Work: (under review) Schultz, Michael. “Prospects for the Statistical Testing of Internally Generated Hypotheses: Research Designs and Metrics.

item.title: About
item.description: Escrito em Go, Hugo é um gerador de sites estáticos de código aberto disponível sobre a licença Apache Licence 2.0. O Hugo suporta TOML, YAML e JSON como arquivos de dados, Markdown e HTML como arquivos de conteúdo, e usa shortcodes para adicionar conteúdos ricos. Outras funcionalidades notaveis são taxonomias, modo multilingual, processamento de imagens, formatos de saída customizaveis, minificação de HTML/CSS/JS e suporte a fluxos SASS/SCSS.
